meta.content: Official Singles Chart on 18/12/2020 | Official Charts

content.title: Official Singles Chart on 18/12/2020
content.description: The Official UK Singles Chart reflects the UK’s biggest songs of the week, based on audio and video streams, downloads, CDs and vinyl, compiled by the Official Charts Company. The UK Top 40 is broadcast on BBC Radio 1, the Top 100 is published exclusively on OfficialCharts.com. View the biggest songs of 2024 so far.

drupalComments.title: 42afff0f-373b-4b4b-b7e7-f445e43f5802
drupalComments.body:
I find the comments saying "disqualify old Christmas songs from the UK singles chart" ridiculous. The charts are meant as a measure pf what is the most popular tune in Britain in any given week - and not engineered to make a song look falsely popular to appease artists or fans of an artist.

And for a few weeks and especially the couple near Christmas that will be classic Christmas songs. People say its not fair on non seasonal songs but in that case don't release your song in those couple of weeks when Christmas songs proliferate in the charts. As an oldie myself the Christmas chart is the only one I look at these days and how the various Christmas songs do each year is interesting in itself. any fiddling with the chart to remove certain types of record would be the death knell for the charts as we've known them for the past nearly 70 years.

drupalComments.title: 0266d370-a506-4bdb-b3b1-9d75453574f3
drupalComments.body: Where is the big selling track about our erstwhile prime minister? Even Relax and God Save The Queen where given their dues in chart placings if still banned from airplay. Controlling media in such a fashion smacks of something very dodgy indeed.

drupalComments.title: 05bbd9c4-848b-41c0-8e3f-acfa95cb10e5
drupalComments.body:
Here's all the UK #1s of 2020 ranked from best to worst in my opinion. I'm not going to count All I Want For Christmas Is You because it's from the 90s and I'm not going to count the two charity songs we've already had this year as I think it would be a bit unfair to judge them purely as a song and we're probably going to have a charity song next week for the Christmas #1 so I won't include that either.

1) Blinding Lights
2) Head & Heart
3) Rain On Me
4) Mood
5) Roses
6) Own It
7) Godzilla
8) Rockstar
9) No Time To Die
10) Before You Go
11) Lemonade
12) Positions
13) Savage Love
14) Toosie Slide
15) WAP

drupalComments.title: deee9ee2-1d09-4b98-a0d7-5ab8be376cef
drupalComments.body:
I'm probably going to get a lot of backlash for this, but...

... this chart kind of proves why the rules introduced in 2017 don’t work.

Like, you ban all album bombs by all artists so that they can only have a maximum of three songs each in the chart, yet you allow like 60 Christmas songs to fill up the Top 100? Either let both of them happen, or neither of them happen, not just the one.

I’m sorry, but for as much as I adore most Christmas songs, it’s just really unfair on artists who want to release their own music in December!

Maybe cap them to like the Top 20 or something? Then we’d still get the festive favourites each year, but it’d be much better for some newer or upcoming artists. :)

children.title: de7c52c4-05f9-4780-af32-089c30061073
children.body: I hate album bombs but 3 songs per artist is way too little. Maybe 6 or 7 per album.

children.title: d9e836d2-9e8e-4afc-8d2f-48c96d9c3815
children.body: well, i do adore christmas songs but they shouldn’t take up that much space. the three songs rule is nonsense. but hey, that’s just how the charts work... (shrugs)

children.title: bfc029d7-f47e-463f-90b4-cc47b70e0bd9
children.body: I love the christmas songs filling up the chart, i would love the whole top 100 to be xmas songs

children.title: 8c0d3db4-168f-4c27-aa7e-0bf52227bcfa
children.body:
Yeah, I like said on the server earlier, you can't really make a fair comparison between Christmas songs to "normal" songs in December, since streaming playlists will obviously prioritise the former.

I've also said my piece many times on ACR too! :P

That wouldn't have affected Taylor at all this week though! :P

children.title: 3c744d2f-4019-467a-8cf2-87d52db96d2c
children.body:
I just think the Christmas songs flooding the charts aren't consistent with the rules that all other songs would be! I certainly love them being in the chart every December, but were the charts made to tell us that people listen to Christmas songs at Christmas? I don't think so, haha.

Oh well, I'm back home now, so I'm starting to feel a bit more festive tonight! :P

children.title: 6ac826ac-307f-45d8-8630-96f0b5de59ac
children.body: Agree and disagree...I agree with the album tracks, if the track has not been officially released as a SINGLE then it should not be allowed in the SINGLES chart. but disagree with limiting how many tracks per artist. If someone releases 10 singles in one week and they all sell enough to chart then all 10 deserve to be there or if someone has a previous singles still hanging in the charts that's fine too as long as they are selling enough to chart. Same as the Christmas stuff if has been released as a single and sells enough it has a right to chart.

children.title: a28623b0-815b-44fa-b771-9b3b5554c8c9
children.body: The charts are meant to show what people are listening to and right now people are listening to Christmas songs lol

children.title: 40ca757a-39de-4908-b5c4-366d8ceb6b81
children.body: Yes but you dont let one hit wonders go into the top 40^^

children.title: 9060b918-f94b-4290-98a8-3c22eea5cb5a
children.body: Ah. so your point is saying that it has to be released as an official single in order to chart... I kind of agree, due to the name of the chart, but what about if somebody puts out an album & there's a very clear fan favourite within that week? There's not really a lot of time to start promoting that, especially if some pre-released tracks will still be getting a lot radio airplay, but I do get your point to some extent. :)

children.title: e4d8db33-f034-4b9f-92e7-e402fbdff719
children.body: I guess, but it just means that we get one month of the year where people who aren't releasing Christmas songs will find it almost impossible to chart! I don't want to see that... even if a rising star appeared with a credited Top 100 (hence the cap idea) that would still be good to see. :)

children.title: 6d40a8aa-71a8-44c8-819c-3b8f587b1379
children.body: If a cap isn't introduced, who knows, maybe one day the entire top 100 will be filled entirely of Christmas songs! XD

children.title: 91ab8a7c-7d37-41df-b06e-b48b7756fc9c
children.body: Well the earliest that Christmas songs appear in the chart is around mid to late November and then they're out the chart by January so it's only about 6 weeks having Christmas songs out of 52 weeks of the year

children.title: 1ada8549-cb3c-4d21-9318-bfccb40259a2
children.body: That's what I'm thinking! The Christmas takeover is just going to get bigger & bigger every year, as we've seen since the introduction of streaming into the charts, haha. :)

children.title: 448f75b6-6321-48c5-8a22-2cb277533a92
children.body: That's still over 10% of the year, which means that some of the biggest Christmas songs ('All I Want For Christmas Is You' & 'Last Christmas') will probably sneak on to the Chart Of The Year for 2020! :P

children.title: eb865f69-ff04-44cb-b115-187d3a88443d
children.body: Precisely. Even last year Wham were 95th in the EOY chart, and Mariah 84th! Both will be higher this year, definitely

children.title: 784a29c7-51ed-42db-a8b5-f940feb611d4
children.body: Maybe 'Fairytale Of New York' could sneak in there too, haha. :)

children.title: 6ce6e349-771b-4c91-9cbc-caed4f857a7b
children.body: Yeah, that's what I'm thinking. Probably Mariah around 63rd, Wham 80th, and FONY about 96th

children.title: 0162af10-d73d-4a11-84d8-107b53cd2ed8
children.body: Good guesses! Will we get a year where Mariah gets so many streams in December that she ends up in the Top 40? ;)

children.title: 4218094f-d7a3-4cfd-8a0d-a2cc4b013ecb
children.body: that’d be overkill lmao, but it’d definitely be interesting.

children.title: 88283bc7-9178-4c3c-b7aa-82ec6a204feb
children.body: What they should do is restrict the number of ACR songs to around 10 so only the top of the charts is flooded with Christmas songs allowing newer songs to chart.

children.title: 3cb02fc3-3760-4d53-842d-fb3203fc9cc3
children.body: They won't do that though as there are so many songs on ACR, meaning that the likes of Dance Monkey might get another run in the top 40

children.title: a9477c5d-3fd9-42d3-90bf-a419c94c9481
children.body: Yeah, that sounds like an approach that might work. :)

children.title: e7e607a3-355d-45ae-8f06-5ec72b9b1ad7
children.body: Definitely, maybe not next year but sometime this decade I think

children.title: 3bc6331e-a526-45fa-8839-9df41d43aee2
children.body: at least legends like Mariah take their revenge haha

children.title: 62a38772-9f27-4ab4-8649-573861d9d3a2
children.body: They do! That being said, she'll be dethroned by sausage roll guy on Friday. :/

children.title: ef8b1df6-0033-4f0a-a4ac-89abd3340b45
children.body: I think so too, especially given how early everyone started this year, haha. :)

children.title: c3b95e53-a099-48ea-afd2-a85b76a538c8
children.body: Seems that a lot of the christmas songs are dropping this week, which means people must be getting fed up of them since mid November. They started listening way too early

children.title: 10d813ca-d85d-40c0-b02b-0418ce451b82
children.body:
I don't think it's even the fact that everyone started early this year, but more because the latest restrictions around a large part of the country means that people are sadly feeling less festive. :/

Also, the First Look & Monday's Update are always based more on sales, so the Christmas classics tend to climb back throughout the course of the week!

drupalComments.title: 8b33c26f-51a3-40c2-aa63-8fe42e3b3894
drupalComments.body:
For as much as I’d be very tired of seeing it for the third year running, it looks like LadBaby will probably be taking the Christmas #1 of 2020 next week, given the massive first day sales numbers that he’s got!

I’m personally backing JB’s remake of ‘Holy’ with the NHS Choir! After the disaster that 2020 has been for everyone, the tributes & proceeds need to go to the tirelessly working doctors & nurses of our nation have that saved many lives during this pandemic.

Mind you, given the insane streaming numbers that she’ll be getting throughout the next week & the fact that Christmas Day falls on a Friday (the day the tracking week changes) this year, I wouldn’t even rule out Mariah just yet! :P

children.title: 0d6e0083-278e-4f07-a319-3114f342dbb6
children.body: To be honest, its clear that he actually cares about the charity this year. The past two years the song was solely about sausage rolls, but this year the lyrics are majoritively about supporting key workers and the Trussell Trust. But the song itself, aside from the lyrics, is worse than the last two years in terms of rhythm and flow, but it does grow on you the more you listen to it. Currently a strong 6/10 but could get higher in the next few days. Personally, as much as I don't like his songs that much, I'm backing JB like you, but I think its a three-way-race between LadBaby, JB and Mariah, which will end in that order.

children.title: 31fae61a-2470-4f52-bec3-7248c1ec3cb4
children.body:
LadBaby had like a 60x times lead though & yeah, while his songs are getting annoying, I always have to respect him for the cause, especially in a year like this.

Either way, it's going to be one of the more interesting Christmas #1 battles in a while! :P

children.title: 7d4143c1-78fc-4126-8833-46e83c59c720
children.body: And he'll fall the week after lol

children.title: 0df06c68-d160-4462-b8ca-8f8004ed2dfc
children.body: Yep. Last year he went from 1 to 52, the second biggest fall for a song in OCC history, after Three Lions went from 1-97

children.title: e0f46a08-298c-4287-b13f-fea5e1eb46c3
children.body: I bet he'll almost drop out of the Top 100 by next week, since the following chart update will be on New Year's Day! :P

children.title: 0ee351fa-1562-463c-904c-81b861513ce3
children.body: That's a good point, I didn't think of that. Usually the week after Christmas is when the Christmas songs rise a bit more (and when Mariah peaks at 2 annually), but this time that probably won't happen, Mariah might still be there on New Year's day, but she will definitely be gone on my birthday (the week after)

children.title: 3a379fb7-50ee-4524-ac98-e6cf653c5b77
children.body: I'm confused about the rules nowadays. Would the Justin Bieber / NHS thing count as a new single or just another version of the single that was in recently? That's what they did with Levitating and lots of other things with a million remixes and re-recodings. They seem to whack all the Band Aids together even though they're completely different artists in every conceivable way. All very confusing!

children.title: 0a6021cb-420a-42a8-a406-5e6b1935f59b
children.body: I don't know, but I imagine they'll just recredit it, but with the NHS Choir featuring alongside JB instead of Chance The Rapper. :)

children.body: The band aids still chart separately, you will most likely see band aid 2 in next week's chart

children.title: 0940a595-2c32-46e0-a726-77c9d092ed7e
children.body: Why does everyone think JB will do so well next week?

children.title: 2d1ff2e6-f8c4-46a5-b854-a417a8687ec4
children.body: Interesting that you have Christmas Day, New Year's Day & your birthday all in the same two weeks of one another! Extra big celebration for you each year then, I'm guessing? ;)

children.title: f2591424-2056-441e-8728-17dfe8674689
children.body: Exactly, the best time of year for me, definitely!

children.title: 71009d8c-6228-472a-9627-6601b650974a
children.body: They're all hoping for LadBaby to not be number 1 XD. It probably will peak at 2 next week

children.title: c29d89c8-2d44-4374-b70c-75cd33b70b2f
children.body: To be fair, I do not think they will stand a chance of being No.1 again as there is much more competition than ever and to be honest it is all about sausage rolls and eating. I respect that they are releasing this for charity and I am not being rude but the lyrics are sorta lame. I guess it gets more boring through the years when they release a song.

children.title: 44f31a88-b7ef-493f-a080-874287f76597
children.body:
Yeah, I have nothing against LadBaby doing this for charity at all, but it's becoming repetitive at this point!

We need another charity song like supporting our hard-working key workers to get #1 instead! I wouldn't even mind the song against the person who ruined Christmas to get there either. :/

children.title: 0f488ccd-0472-4793-a766-219533573114
children.body: It would be for me normally, buy yesterday's announcement badly affected our family's plans. :/

children.title: 2edc653a-a97b-48f2-900b-b486390931f8
children.body: I can understand, I'm assuming you live in a tier 4 place. Living in tier 2 though, I can only empathise.

children.title: 7ce2cca3-7bbe-47b6-ae4e-774a35402d78
children.body: I live in a Tier 1 actually, but my older brother lives in Tier 4, so we'll really be missing him this Christmas! :(

drupalComments.title: 614efe2a-f7fd-46d0-a5a2-66fbf695b019
drupalComments.body: Since it's Christmas next week, a lot of us will be spending our time enjoying ourselves with our families at home. But there are some people who sadly won't have that luxury and they are the heroes called the NHS workers who have had to deal with a real a horrible year working endless hours to put others first and provide care for others. Make sure they are in your hearts when you wake up Christmas morning and are sitting at the table for Christmas Dinner. God bless the NHS.

children.title: 39f0d8ff-f09a-4a90-b99e-f6f58ad6db41
children.body: Well said! This is why I really want them to be #1 next week. :)

children.title: 19b82d81-99dc-425b-9a9c-88bab7932fb9
children.body: Even if it isn't #1, it will raise so much money for charity which what it's all about, same with LadBaby

children.title: 5daafa21-ef73-4c76-a9f1-e49b83bef86f
children.body: As I've always said, the chart position doesn't really matter, the proceeds do. :)

children.title: df9e6e18-b96c-4139-82fb-491ed7d27806
children.body: Yes they will be, in England you teally support charity singles, in France no one cares about charity, sad!

children.body: The amount of charity singles this year is mental. THe money that will go towards all of these causes is amazing and I'm supportive of all of the causes

children.body:

children.body: Yes I commented on the article^^ its cool I think. The french singles chart is not as good as the british one...but this week the number one is fever by Angele & Dua, my favourite song for weeks so Im happy!

children.title: 674a9db0-f68d-4469-91b4-5920f31dbdd2
children.body: 😁maybe, maybe not...

children.title: 2ea90b1a-db92-482b-af36-104c96d29113
children.body: Honestly, your #1 is the best one France has had in months. I love 'Fever'! :D

drupalComments.title: 22784148-6c59-4683-b4d8-66e29b1052e1
drupalComments.body:
Honestly, I don’t know how to feel about ‘Willow’ debuting at #3!

On one hand, I’m incredibly happy that Taylor can still manage to get Top 3 singles after almost 15 years in the music industry & with her ninth studio album, but it’s so frustrating knowing that this amazing ballad was purely denied going all the way only because of the particular time of the year it is. :/

Literally, this would probably be a clear winner if it was released in any month!

Oh well, at least it’s awesome that ‘Champagne Problems’ & especially ‘No Body, No Crime’ joined it as the next highest debuts. :)

I’m also delighted that ‘Evermore’ itself became her sixth #1 album, making her the first living artist of the 21st century to lead the albums chart twice in the same year! :D

No matter what you think of the album (& you’re always entitled to your opinion), you can’t deny that she put a lot of time & effort into this over lockdown.

children.title: 9d79c2f0-888b-415c-9eb8-fd90d6a399a5
children.body: Yes, seemed a strange Decision to go up against all the Christmas songs in the singles charts. But albums usually sell more in December, so perhaps that's the driving force.

children.title: 7cf8bebf-34d3-46ea-9594-a7a98e3aa9af
children.body: Yeah, I think Taylor is trying to be more of an albums artists than a singles artist at this point! I also have a feeling that she also wanted to release it now to drive Christmas sales & also because it was her birthday this past weekend. :)

children.title: 130b93bd-3006-417e-9451-7e181cd7d82c
children.body:
Give it 2 weeks after all the Christmas dropout and the traditional low January sales.
#1 then!

children.title: 63a397e4-09a3-4394-b8bb-64e4f905b6ff
children.body: 'Positions' is also going on ACR soon, so it doesn't look like there's a lot that'll challenge it in the New Year for now. :)

children.title: 0bc4618f-7e8a-468d-bbdd-2eee1580d6f9
children.body: Those older holiday hits should have a separate chart since they come back every year. Only new releases are allowed to chart on the OSC Top 100. It's so frustrating to see my queen being blocked from topping the singles chart😣

children.title: f9ddd59b-246a-49da-acf9-bc9a768f2e91
children.body: Tbh. This particular time of the year is the reason why it's number 3, nothing much to compete with. So fingers crossed for January

children.title: 393933af-ad27-4ce9-9583-626a82d91ae7
children.body: Hopefully... we know who's getting it on Christmas Day though. :/

children.title: 7fa369e0-758d-4821-b759-53a0d40e9bf4
children.body: I kind of agree & yeah, it would've been amazing to see Taylor score her second #1 today. She's my queen too! Actually, no, she's my goddess, haha. :)

children.title: f21f000d-5128-47af-b50d-77bdb0545e62
children.body: Yeah :/

children.title: 36a0bf34-12a9-4bab-b23b-c42afe768892
children.body: Why don't you just create your own chart - that way it would have all you favourite music on rather than everyone else's.

children.title: afcd96ca-907d-4bd6-84a0-080006f18fe3
children.body:
I've been doing just that for over four years now.

Here's my chart for this week: http://crownnote.c*m/charts/piran-delves/pirans-top-50-44
(replace the * with an o, as OCC don't allow links anymore)

Yeah, there's a lot of Taylor & Christmas this week, but I usually try to keep my music taste as diverse as possible & I usually even do a list of throwbacks too! :P
